title: George Clooney On Trump: ‘Can Only Hope For The Best’
text:
Ivanka Trump Sheds Potential Conflicts of Interest 
The actor said the country needs Trump to be, at the very least, a competent leader. 
“At this moment in our lives, we have to hope (Trump) doesn’t destroy everything,” Clooney said. “The reality is you have to hope he will do a decent job because if the United States fails, really terrible things happen, so you have to hope that he can.” 
While confusing and a bit double-sided, this statement was at the very least an improvement from his past condemnations of the president-elect. During an interview with The Guardian last March, for instance, Clooney slammed Trump as “an opportunist,”“a fascist” and a “xenophobic fascist.” Advertisement - story continues below 
Likewise, in 2015 the Hollywood actor took a swipe at Trump for what Clooney described as the “idiotic” remarks the then-candidate made about illegal immigrants. 
“The U.S. has become a dumping ground for everybody else’s problems,” Trump said in June of that year. “They’re sending people that have lots of problems, and they’re bringing those problems with us. They’re bringing drugs. They’re bringing crime. They’re rapists. And some, I assume, are good people.” 
“Clearly, what he said is idiotic, of course it’s idiotic,” Clooney remarked three months later. “Anybody who says as intolerant words as those should be laughed at and that’s pretty much [what] I think eventually history will do.” 
Last May, Clooney assured the international press at the Cannes there would “never be a President Donald Trump.” Advertisement - story continues below
